org.gatein.api.navigation

Interface Navigation


  • public interface Navigation
    Navigation for a site responsible for the retrieval, saving, and removal of navigation nodes.
    Author:
    Nick Scavelli, Stian Thorgersen

    • Method Summary

      • getPriority

        int getPriority()
        The priority of the navigation. This can be used to determine the order in which navigations of the same SiteType appear in a navigation menu.
        Returns:
        the priority

        the node or null if the node was not found

        IllegalArgumentException - if nodePath is null

      • getNode

        Node getNode(NodePath nodePath,
           NodeVisitor visitor)
        Returns a node represented by the node path or null if the node was not found. The NodeVisitor is then used to determine further loading of nodes.

        For example if you want to retrieve the node /foo/bar but also want to load it's children you can pass in Nodes.visitChildren() as the visitor to load the children of /foo/bar.

        Parameters:
        nodePath - the path to the node
        visitor - the visitor used to determine further loading of nodes. The visitor is relative to the node represented by the node path.
        Returns:
        the node or null if the node was not found
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if nodePath or visitor is null
        ApiException - if something prevented this operation to succeed

      • getRootNode

        Node getRootNode(NodeVisitor visitor)
        Returns the root node of the navigation with nodes loaded dependent on the NodeVisitor
        Parameters:
        visitor - the visitor to determine how many nodes to load.
        Returns:
        the root node of the navigation
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if visitor is null
        ApiException - if something prevented this operation to succeed

      • refreshNode

        void refreshNode(Node node)
        Will refresh the node with latest from storage. For example if nodes were added/removed, etc you can refresh/sync those changes. The refresh will affect the entire tree even if the node is not the root of the tree. When conflicting changes exist, a merge will be attempted, however it could fail and lead to a non resolvable situation.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to refresh
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if node is null
        ApiException - if something prevented this operation to succeed

      • refreshNode

        void refreshNode(Node node,
               NodeVisitor visitor)
        Will refresh the node with latest from storage. The refresh will affect the entire tree even if the node is not the root of the tree. When conflicting changes exist, a merge will be attempted, however it could fail and lead to a non resolvable situation. The visitor can be used to control new nodes to load.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to refresh
        visitor - the visitor which can load more nodes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if node or visitor is null
        ApiException - if something prevented this operation to succeed

      • removeNode

        boolean removeNode(NodePath nodePath)
        Removes a node, represented by the node path
        Parameters:
        nodePath - the path to the node
        Returns:
        true if the node was removed, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if nodePath is null
        EntityNotFoundException - if the node could not be found.
        ApiException - if something prevented this operation to succeed

      • saveNode

        void saveNode(Node node)
        Saves a node. All changes to the entire tree will be saved even if the node is not the root of the tree.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to save
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if node is null
        ApiException - if something prevented this operation to succeed
